div.ab: besieged Gibraltar but died of the plague. Yusef made a lamentn for his enemy. Moors put on mourning. Moors besieged at Gibraltar attended enemy’s funeral in respect. This all the way to Seville. Yusef in 1354 in mosque of Alhambra a maniac from behind ran a dagger into side. The murderer cut in pieces & burnt to satisfy populace. Buried in a Tomb of white marble “Here lies a King & Martyr of an illustrious line gentle learned virtuous, renowned for the graces of his person & his manners, whose clemency piety & benevolence were extolled throughout the kingdom of Granada. He was a great prince, an illustrious Captain a sharp sword of the moslems, a valiant standard bearer among the most potent monarchs &c &c &c. – Tomb no longer exists – This in Marmol.This appears to be a summary of Geoffrey Crayon [Washington Irving], The Alhambra, 2 vols (London, 1832), vol. 2, pp. 296-9 - WG follows Irving's topics and word-choice closely and the quotation exactly, save for punctuation, but Irving does not cite Mármol. It might be possible that WG and Irving are both reading Mármol, but elsewhere WG certainly draws on Irving and the similarities are extremely close here.

figure.note: Pen and ink drawing with watercolour: man
Pen and ink drawing with watercolour: man
figure.label: o Joachim

div.label: To Granada by Alhama.
div.ab: Malaga to Velez Malaga on horseback 4 Hours. Turn Left into Mountains. Velez to Alhama 7 Hours. Alhama to Granada 7H seeing in way the baths.

Granada to Jaen by the direct road thro a pass. Quit Granada at 5H. leaving the VegaFertile Plain a Village at 9 where stop 45 minutes. At 4 p M4pm a Village in MtsMountains. Next day set out at 5 Jaen at 1.
